content.webTitle: The Guardian’s horse racing team tops league table of tipsters for 2015

fields.headline: The Guardian’s horse racing team tops league table of tipsters for 2015
fields.bodyText: The Guardian’s horse racing team are champion tipsters for 2015, having topped a league table published on Friday. The Racing Post’s Press Challenge tracks the fate of all tips offered by national daily newspapers as well as a couple of the Post’s own tipsters and records a convincing success for the Guardian over the course of last year. The paper’s tips in 2015 generated a return of 93.55%, more than 2% better than its nearest rival. The Guardian was the only paper whose tips performed better than all favourites taken collectively. “It’s been a real team effort,” said Chris Cook, the Guardian’s lead tipster for the past three years. “Greg Wood and Tony Paley have done plenty of tipping, as always, and we also had winners from John O’Hara and Chris Corrigan. “It’s really pleasing to have won and an indication of how consistent our tips have been. We went to the top of the table in late March and I believe we’ve been there every day since. “After we’d been at the top for a few months, we all started to think about how depressing it would be to get run down close home after leading for so long. But fortunately there was no one playing Red Rum to our Crisp on this occasion.” The Guardian finished with 2,368 winning tips over the year at a strike rate of 26%. Highlights included finding four of the first five winners at the Cheltenham Festival, most notably The Druids Nephew at 8-1.
